chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This document is for developers using the ohNet stack to develop Control Point applications.

ohNet is a full UPnP stack, the public APIs of which are protocol independent. The Control Point stack exposes the parts of ohNet required to develop a Control Point application. It offers APIs using C++, C# and C.

note.para: All code examples in this document use C++. Each C++ function used has an equivalent in the other languages. The naming scheme for the functions is consistent between the languages so you can easily find the functions in the other languages published in the API.

chapter.para: Specific emphasis is placed on the use of Proxies in the development of a Control Point application. The generation of Proxy code from simple XML is demonstrated, which shows how the use of Proxies allows the stack to remain device and protocol independent.
